come to work wire how can they be motivated and he characterized two
different kinds of motivation so one the Theory X style manager is the person
that believes that people are inherently lazy they avoid responsibility and they
require extrinsic motivation in other words micromanagement or being told what
to do on the other hand is the theory Y style of leader or the theory Y style of
organization which believes that people are intrinsically motivated they genuinely want to seek ownership and
seek responsibility and they want to perform well so in a Theory X organization sort of management's at the
top it's very authoritarian it's very repressive very tight control over what
people are doing you can see the management on the top like pushing down on the staff yuck whereas in a theory Y
